br.span: If you need to check out a Chromebook, please call 903-694-7550 and schedule an appointment. The pickup location is now the Technology Building. Enter the Libby/Primary bus drive from Davis St. Stop at the first building on your left at the glass door.

h2.strong: Parents have the option to Press 5 to opt out of receiving any

automated calls from Carthage ISD. But, please be aware that this includes all calls such as early release days or school closures in case of weather or any type of school emergency. Please consider this before opting out of attendance calls or any other types of campus/district calls.

span.a: Click here for Texas Transition and Employment Guide.

span.style: text-align: justify; line-height: 17.12px; font-size: 14px; font-family: Arial; color: rgb(0, 0, 0);

div.span: The Texas Transition and Employment Guide provides youth, young adults, parents and professionals with secondary transition resources to facilitate a young person’s progress towards post-secondary goals to education, employment, and community living.

span.style: text-align: justify; font-size: 14px; font-family: Arial; color: rgb(0, 0, 0);

div.span: This guide will continually be updated.

p.style: color: rgb(51, 51, 51); font-family: arial, helvetica, clean, sans-serif; font-size: 13px;
text-align: justify; font-family: arial, helvetica, clean, sans-serif;

span.span: he Carthage Independent School District does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, national origin, sex, disability, or age in its programs and activities, including CTE programs, and provides equal access to the Boy Scouts and other designated youth groups.
For inquiries regarding the non-discrimination policies please contact Mr. John Wink, Superintendent #1 Bulldog Drive Carthage, TX 75633 (903)693-3806.

p.style: text-align: justify; color: rgb(51, 51, 51); font-family: arial, helvetica, clean, sans-serif;

span.span: For further information on notice of non-discrimination, call 1-800-421-3481 or visit
